sentences.english: John took park in a Singing Competition last Saturday!
sentences.chinese: 约翰上周六参加了一次歌咏比赛。

sentences.english: After the meeting, held a singing of the General Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 大会结束后，举行了歌咏大会。

sentences.english: Maria won the first prize in the singing-match yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天的歌咏比赛中，马里亚得了一等奖。

sentences.english: It all began with a singing competition in 1984
sentences.chinese: 一切皆始于1984年的一个歌咏比赛。

sentences.english: I won the first prize in singing competition yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天的歌咏比赛中，马里亚得了一等奖。

sentences.english: I shall enter for the singing competition.
sentences.chinese: 我将报名参加歌咏比赛。

sentences.english: Mary won first place in the singing contest.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽在歌咏比赛中得第一名。

sentences.english: Will you the singing competition week.
sentences.chinese: 你愿意在下周歌咏比赛上当裁判吗？

sentences.english: Maria won first prize in yesterday’s singing competition.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的歌咏比赛中，玛丽亚获得了一等奖。

sentences.english: The excellent singing, and a series of community service.
sentences.chinese: 歌咏及一连串的社区服务计划吸引著我。

sentences.english: The judges ranked Mary the best in the singing contest.
sentences.chinese: 评判员评定玛丽为歌咏比赛的第一名。

sentences.english: A singing meet will take place next week.
This article second chapter elaborated the poets before Tang Dynasty to Bashu culture's sing.
sentences.chinese: 本文第二章论述了唐代以前诗人对巴蜀的歌咏。

sentences.english: Mom, I've won the first place in the singing contest.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈，我在歌咏比赛中获得第一名。

sentences.english: Together with the choir and symphony orchestra of Shenzhen.
sentences.chinese: 由深圳女子学院的歌咏队伴唱，深圳交响乐队伴奏。

definition: to sing the praises of/to extol/to eulogize
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
a poem/a composition in verse/fig. epic (compared with historical epic)/the biblical Book of Psalms
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
